chapter.title: Getting Started
chapter.para: This chapter assumes that you have already successfully downloaded and installed &product; and is focused on getting you aquainted with &productdesktop; edition. It gives you a quick tour of the Main Workspace of &productshort; including the Main Menu and View Panels. It also covers setting of the program Preferences so that you may configure &productshort; to work with the options settings of your choice.

The best way to get started using &productshort; is to first familiarise yourself with Main Workspace. This will give you an understanding of what features and functions are available and how to find them when using the program. Once familiar, it is recomended that you adjust the basic settings available in the Preferences.

sect2.title: Starting with a User Profile
sect2.para: A frequent need is for two or more persons to use &productshort; on the same desktop computer. For instance members of a household may use the same computer or one family member may perform dive uploads for other family members/friends. There are two approaches for doing this:

sect3.xreflabel: Using a Single System User Account
sect3.title: Using a Single System User Account
sect3.para: If the different users of a desktop computer do not log onto the desktop/laptop under different user names then the simplest way is for each person to use her/his own divelog file within &productshort;.
In this case John would work with the &productshort; file johns-divelogbook and Joan would use joans-divelogbook. The appropriate dive divelogbook can be selected by selecting File Open logbook .

However, a problem arises if the users prefer different settings for &productshort;. For instance, one diver may prefer to see the dive ceiling in the Profile Panel and media icons in the Dive List, while the other may not have these preferences. In addition, the cloud connection is normally unique for each &productshort; installation and if more than one user wishes to save dive data on the cloud, it is inconvenient to open the Preferences and change the authentication details every time the cloud is accessed.
To solve these problems, launch &productshort; with a --user=<user name> command-line option. John can then activate &productshort; with this command-line instruction:
while Joan can launch &productshort; using:

In this case, each userâ€™s preferences, settings and cloud access information are stored separately, allowing each diver to interact with &productshort; in thier preferred way and with individual cloud access. The above process can be made user-friendly by creating a link/shortcut with a desktop icon that executes the above command-line instruction.

Use of the --user= option therefore enables each user to create, maintain and backup a separate dive log within a personalised user interface. This way, when each diver launches &productshort;, it opens with the correct dive log as well as the appropriate display and backup preferences, and each diver can access their own divelog on a mobile device using &productmobile;.

sect3.title: Using Seperate System User Accounts
sect3.para: On the other hand, if the users log onto the same computer using different userIDs and passwords (i.e. users each have a separate user space), &productshort; is available independently to each user and every diver automatically has a separate user profile and settings, including unique cloud and &productmobile; access.

sect2.title: View Panels
sect2.para: Within the main workspace there are four view panels. For purpose of clarity when refering to these panels, the panels are named as follows:

listitem.para: (bottom left)
(bottom right)
(top left)

sect2.para: The dividers between panels can be dragged to change the size of any of the panels. &productshort; remembers the position of the dividers, so the next time starts it uses the positions of the dividers from the last time the program was used.

If a single dive is selected in the &paneldivelist; panel, the dive location, detailed information and profile of the selected dive are shown in the respective panels. If several dives are selected, the last highlighted dive is the selected dive, but summary data of all highlighted dives is shown in the Stats tab of the &paneldiveinfo; panel (maximum, minimum and average depths, durations, water temperatures and SAC; total time and number of dives selected).

sect3.title: &paneldivelist;
sect3.para: The &paneldivelist; panel lists the dives in the logbook. Each dive log is a record in the &paneldivelist;. Dive logs can selected using the mouse pointer and clicking a record or using the UP and DOWN keys on the keyboard.

sect3.title: &paneldivemap;
sect3.para: Shows the dive site location of the record selected in the &paneldivelist;. The dive location is displayed centered on a world map and marked by a dive flag. The map scale can be increased or decreased.

sect3.title: &paneldiveinfo;
sect3.para: Shows more detailed information on the dive selected in the &paneldivelist;, including some statistics for the selected dive or for all highlighted dive(s).

sect3.title: &paneldiveprofile;
sect3.para: Shows a graphical dive profile of the selected dive in the &paneldivelist;. You can zoom into the dive profile for a more detailed view.

sect1.title: Setting Preferences
sect1.para: The Preferences dialog enables setting of your personal preferences and requirements when working with &productdesktop;. Settings saved in the Preferences will remain persistant for all future sessions of the program. Settings within the Preferences dialog are grouped as follows:
Select File Preferences to display the Preferences dialog.

sect2.title: General Settings
sect2.para: Select File Preferences General to display the General preferences.

sect3.title: Lists and tables
sect3.para: The Lists and tables group enables you to select the type and size of font used throughout the user interface. The default font and size is dependant on your operating system defaults.

sect3.title: Dives
sect3.para: The Dives group enables you to define whether or not you want to use a default file for storing dive logs, options include:

listitem.para: Select the No default radio button to disable use of a default log file.

Select the Local default file radio button to enable use of a default log file. By default &productshort; will define a default path and file name for the default. You may choose to remain with the default suggestion or select a different path and file name.

note.para: Whether you choose to use the suggest default path and file name or another, you must click the Use default button to make use of the specified Local dive log file path.

listitem.para: Select the Cloud storage default file radio button to use &productcloud; as the default location for storage.

sect3.title: Default Cylinder
sect3.para: The Use default cylinder drop list displays a list of known scuba cylinder models. When a default is selected it will be used in the Equipment the &paneldiveinfo; panel.

sect3.title: Animations
sect3.para: Some actions in showing the dive profile are performed using animations. For instance, the axis values for depth and time change from dive to dive. When viewing a different dive, these changes in axis characteristics do not happen instantaneously, but are animated. The _Speed_ of animations can be controlled by setting this slider with faster animation speed to the left, and a 0 value representing no animation at all.

sect3.title: Video thumbnails
sect3.para: The Video thumbnails group provides settings for management of thumbnails related to videos that may be associated with dives, including:

listitem.para: Select the Extract video thumbnails checkbox to enable use of thumbnails.
Specify the path to the FFMPEG program used to perform manipulation on video files.

Slide the Extract folder slider to select the frame within the video timeline to be used as the video thumbnail. The left and right-most positions of the slider position signify the beginning and the end of the video, respectively.

note.para: If &productshort; cannot determine the length of the video (this can be the case for AVI files), the first frame of the video will be used.

sect3.title: Proxy
sect3.para: When using the &productshort; cloud and update checks features, &productshort; needs to connect to the &product; servers on the internet. Some networks have a proxy server installed. The proxy server acts as an intermediatry between hosts inside the network and hosts outside the network. Since the proxy server handles all network requests and traffic leaving the network &productshort; needs to be made aware of the proxy and how to interact with it. The Proxy option group enables configuration of the settings required in order to access the internet via the proxy server.

note.para: Please consult your network administrator if you do not know the required information.

listitem.para: Select the No proxy item from the Proxy type drop list when the network does not have a Proxy Server.
Select the System proxy item from the Proxy type drop list when your localhost has a Proxy Server defined.
Select the HTTP proxy item from the Proxy type drop list when the network has a Proxy Server using the HTTP protocol defined.
Select the SOCKS proxy item from the Proxy type drop list when the network has a Proxy Server using UNIX Sockets.

HTTP and SOCKS proxy servers generally reside on a host computer other than your localhost. Enter the proxy servers IP-address or Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN to help &product; resolve requests to the Proxy Server.
HTTP and SOCKS proxy servers run their services listening on a TCP/IP port.
HTTP Proxy servers are normally configured to listen on port 8080.
SOCKS Proxy servers are normally configured to listen on port 1080.

While most Proxy servers are configured to be transparent and do not require authentication, some proxy servers require authentication. In this case &productshort; proxy authentication can be enabled by selecting the Requires authentication checkbox. This will enable the Username and Password fields.

Some proxy servers are configured to require authentication in order to use the services of the Proxy. In this case a username and password is required. Enter the Username of the account to authenticate with.
Enter the password associated with the supplied Username.
